summary.p: This bundle (35-3010) contains a collection of 6 small Upaniṣad-s of the Atharvaveda in Telugu script. There are four Vedas in Indian Hindu traditions. Each of the four Vedā-s— the Ṛgveda, Yajurveda, Sāmaveda, and Atharvaveda has four parts: Samhitā, Brāhmaṇa, Āranyaka, & Upaniṣad. The first two parts of each Veda describes the karmakāṇḍa, i.e., activities, rituals, ceremonies that when performed lead to enjoyment and power. The other two parts of each veda describes the jñānakāṇḍa, the pathway to attain Mokṣa or enlightenment. It deals with liberating knowledge and disclaims actions as a means of attaining Mokṣa. The Upaniṣad-s constitute the concluding portions of the Vedas, they are called Vedānta and they serve as the foundational texts in the theological discourses of many Hindu traditions that are also known as Vedānta. The Upaniṣad-s’ impact later theological and religious expression.
This budle has 6 Upaniṣad-s belonging to the Atharvaveda. The title of those Upaniṣad-s are:

msItem.title: atharvaśira upaniṣad
msItem.incipit: oṃ devā ha vai svargalokamāyaṃste rudramapṛcchan ko bhavān iti| so'bravīdahamekaḥ prathamamāsīdvartāmi ca bhaviṣyāmi ca nānyaḥ kaścinmatto vyatirikta iti| so'ntarādantaraṃ prāviśat, diśaścāntaraṃ prāviśat|
msItem.explicit: āsaptamāt puruṣayugān punātītyāha bhagavānatharvaśiraḥ, sakṛjjaptvaiva śuciḥ sa pūtaḥ karmaṇyo bhavati| dvitīyaṃ japtvā gaṇādhipatvamavāpnoti| tṛtīyaṃ japtvaivamevānupraviśatītyoṃ satyamoṃ satyamoṃ satyam|

msItem.title: paramahaṃsopaniṣad
msItem.author: Independent authority
msItem.incipit: atha yogināṃ paramahaṃsānāṃ ko'yaṃ mārgaḥ| teṣāṃ kā sthitiḥ| iti nārado bhagavantamupagamyovāca| taṃ bhagavānāha| yo'yaṃ paramahaṃsamārgo lokeṣu durlabhataro na tu bāhulyo'pi, yadyeko'pi bhavati, sa eva nityapūtasya iti, sa eva vedapuruṣa iti vuduṣo manyate|
msItem.explicit: yat pūrṇānandaikarasabodhaḥ tad brahmāhamasmīti kṛtakṛtyo bhavati, tad brahmāhamasmīti kṛtakṛtyo bhavati|

msItem.title: amṛtabindūpaniṣad
msItem.author: Independent authority
msItem.incipit: oṃ śāstrāṇyadhītya medhāvī abhyasya ca punaḥ punaḥ| paramaṃ brahmavidyāyā ulkāvānnānyatho tmṛjet| oṅkāraṃ rathamāruhya viṣṇuṃ kṛtvā tu sārathim| brahmalokapadānveṣī rudrārādhanatatparaḥ|
msItem.explicit: samānastasya madhye tu gokṣīrasphāṭikaprabhaḥ| āpāṇḍura udānastu vyāno'pyarcisamaprabhaḥ| yasyaiṣa maṇḍalaṃ bhittvā māruto yāti mūrdhani| yatra yatra mriyedvāpi na sa bhūyo'bhijāyate| na sa bhūyo'bhijāyate|

msItem.title: rāmottaratāpinyupaniṣad
msItem.author: Independent authority
msItem.incipit: oṃ bṛhaspatiruvāca yājñavalkyam | yadanu kurukṣetraṃ devānāṃ devayajanaṃ sarveṣāṃ bhūtānāṃ brahmasadanam | avimuktaṃ vai kurukṣetraṃ devānāṃ devayajanaṃ sarveṣāṃ bhūtānāṃ brahmasadanam | tasmād yatra kvacana gacchati, tadeva manyeteti |
msItem.explicit: oṃ yo vai śrīrāmaḥ sa bhagavān yaśca saccidānandādvaitaikarasātmā bhūrbhuvaḥ svastāsmai vai namo namaḥ | etān brahmavit saptacatvāriṃśanmantraiḥ nityaṃ devaṃ stuvan tato devaḥ proto bhavati, tasmād ya etaiḥ mantraiḥ nityaṃ devaṃ stauti, sa devaṃ paśyati, so'mṛtatvaṃ ca gacchati | so'mṛtatvaṃ ca gacchati |

msItem.title: sarvasāropaniṣad
msItem.incipit: oṃ kathaṃ bandhaḥ, kathaṃ mokṣaḥ kā avidyā kācidyeti jagat svapna suṣuptaṃ turīyañca katham annamayaḥ prāṇamayo manomayaḥ ānandamayaḥ kathaṃ kartā jīvaḥ kṣetrajñaḥ sākṣī kūṭasthaḥ antaryāmī |
msItem.explicit: anādirantarvatnī pramāpramāṇasādhāraṇā, na sato nāsato na sadasato svayamavikārādvikāraheto nirūpyamāṇe asatī anirūpyamāṇe satī lakṣaṇaśūnyā sā māyetyucyate |

msItem.title: cūlikopaniṣad
msItem.author: Independent authority
msItem.incipit: om aṣṭapādaṃ śucirhaṃsaṃ trisūtraṃ maṇimavyayam | dvivartamānaṃ tejasaiddhaṃ sarvaṃ paśyan na paśyati | bhūtasammohane kāle bhinne tamasi ceśvare| antaḥ paśyati satvasthaṃ nirguṇaṃ guṇakoṭare |
msItem.explicit: ya evaṃ śrāvayecchrāddhe brāhmaṇo niyatavrataḥ| akṣayyamannapānañca pitṝṇāṃ copatiṣṭhate| brahma brahmavidhānaṃ tu ye vidurbrāhmaṇādayaḥ | te layaṃ yānti tatraiva nīlāsyā brahmaśāyini || nīlāsyā brahmaśāyini |
